intro: Xanthisma tenuilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and yellow. Xanthisma tenuilobum is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub or chaparral habitats.
